column1: Edwin has two doves. They were given to him by his uncle. He has a nice little house for them. There are two doors in it
column2: where they go in and out. In front of the doors there is a shelf
column3: on which they perch.The doves are free to go where they please; but they always come home at night. They are quite tame. Sometimes they fly up to Edwin's window
column4: and light on the sill. They tap on the pane to let him know they are hungry.Then he opens the window
column5: and feeds them. He gives them corn
column7: and sometimes oats. They like the corn best. One of them is rather apt to be greedy; and both get so much to eat that they are very plump and fat.Here are the doves looking at the turkeys. They do not know what to make of such birds.
